instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: macbook air 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
i dont have history of this macbook, but now it boots up and shows folder with question mark,usb boot is disallow and i am trying to boot from internet recovery but it always shows me error -5010F (46) 

i tried about 20 times, also tried 3 another wifi.

thanks in advance, i hope someone have experience about this problem

threads.title: macbook air 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Can you post your 820-xxxxx board code.
Is an usual step when open a new thread.

Try DFU restore option.
It will erase internal SSD, if possible.
However, any initial data is almost gone.
Do not do it, if you still want to recover data.
Try revive option instead.

threads.title: macbook air 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
it's <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

i tries dfu restore by configurator 2 and after process nothing changed. still same problem

threads.title: macbook air 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message: Does the DFU restore run through the whole process without error? Did you select the "restore" option?

threads.title: macbook air 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message: yes the process finished without any error, and after process macbook turned on automaticaly and asking me to connect wifi and then same error.yes  i selected "restore", not revive

threads.title: macbook air 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Do a PRAM reset and try again with a wired connection. You'll need a USBC to USBA adapter and an Apple USB to LAN adapter. I have not verified if any other adapters work as the EFI needs to have drivers for it to work.
You could also try another WiFi network, make sure is has WPA security enabled.
